Section.Paragraph: In this paper, we present an unsupervised methodology for propagating lexical co-occurrence vectors into an ontology such as WordNet. We evaluate the framework on the task of automatically attaching new concepts into the ontology. Experimental results show 73.9% attachment accuracy in the first position and 81.3% accuracy in the top-5 positions. This framework could potentially serve as a foundation for ontologizing lexical-semantic resources and assist the development of other large-scale and internally consistent collections of semantic information.
